lines.text: Oh, poor miserable Gurgi deserves fierce smackings and whackings on his poor, tender head. Always left with no munchings and crunchings.
I'm Princess Eilonwy. Are you a lord, or a warrior?
Uh, no. Uh... I-I-I'm an assistant pig keeper.
Oh, what a pity. I was so hoping for someone who could help me escape. Oh, well, if you want to come with me, you may.
If great lord go into evil castle, poor Gurgi will never see his friend again. Nope. Never.
Aren't you charming?
And pungent, too.
Oh, Taran, I'm afraid it'll soon be over for us.
I hadn't planned it to end like this, Eilonwy.
Oh, I wish I'd stayed a toad.
Weren't you a bit frightened, Fflewdurr?
A Fflam frightened? That word is not in my vocabulary.
[harp strings vibrate; Fflewddur stops them]
But in this case, well chosen, my dear.
What does a girl know about swords, anyway?
"Girl"? "Girl"? If it wasn't for this *girl*, you would still be in the Horned King's dungeon.
No, master. Not go into evil cauldron.
If I don't, we're all lost. Out of my way.
Gurgi not let his friend die. Taran has many friends. Gurgi has no friends.
No, Gurgi! Don't jump! No!
[Gurgi jumps into Cauldron]
No!
My, what funny little ducklings. Don't they know that the Black Cauldron is indestructible? Now listen carefully. The Black Cauldron can never be destroyed. Only its evil powers can be stopped.
Then there is a way. But how?
A living being must climb into it of its own free will.
Gurgi is bold and brave. He will climb into the evil cauldron.
However, the poor duckling will never climb out alive.

[jumping away from the cauldron]
Yikes!
I presume, my boy, you are the keeper of this oracular pig.

[to a goat]
His majesty, the Horned King. So we meet at last. Ha!
[Taran rattles the goat's horns with his stick]
Even the Horned King shakes with fear. See, Hen? Everyone runs from the famous Taran of Cael Dallben.
[the goat butts Taran and knocks him down]

[pretending to die]
Prydain's finest warrior draws his last breath.
I'm not afraid of the Horned King.
Then you are a very foolish lad. Untried courage is no match for his evil. Just remember that.
[approaching Taran with fury]
You've interfered for the last time!
Ha ha! Go for his throat, sire!

[shouting]
NOW, PIG KEEPER, YOU SHALL DIE!
[first lines]

Legend has it, in the mystic land of Prydain, there was once a king so cruel and so evil, that even the Gods feared him. Since no prison could hold him, he was thrown alive into a crucible of molten iron. There his demonic spirit was captured in the form of a great, Black Cauldron. For uncounted centuries, the Black Cauldron lay hidden, waiting, while evil men searched for it, knowing whoever possessed it would have the power to resurrect an army of deathless warriors... and with them, rule the world...
So much so soon, to rest on his young shoulders.
My, what a brave, handsome group. A pig keeper, a scullery maid, and a broken-down minstrel. Perhaps it would interest you to see what fate has in store for you.
I'm Fflewddur Fflam, minstrel of minstrels! Balladeer to the grandest courts in all the land!
[harp string snaps]
And I, uh, eh? Eh, well, have you forgotten? I have sung in some of the finest courts...
[another string snaps]
Well, I'm only waiting for an invitation.
[another one snaps]
Oh, shush. Why do you have to judge every word I say?
Hen Wen, from you, I do beseech / Knowledge that lies beyond my reach / Troubled thoughts beyond your heart / Pray you now, those thoughts impart.

Oh, my soldiers... Soon the Black Cauldron will be mine. Its evil power will course through my veins, and I shall make you Cauldron Born... Yes, yes, oh yes! Then you will worship ME! Me... Oh, my soldiers... How long I have thirsted to be a god among mortal men...
Have you seen my pig?
Piggy? Round, fat piggy? Big snout?
[snorts]
Yes, yes.
Curly tail?
That's her! That's Hen-Wen!
Uh-uh, Nope. Gurgi not seen piggy. Nope.
It's decided, then. You shall have the Black Cauldron.
You mean, you'll give it to us?
That's not what I said. You weren't listening. We never give anything away. What we do is bargain, trade.
Well, you'll not have my sword!
Oh, I'm sorry. I've ignored you. You did come for the Black Cauldron, didn't you? Good. Then climb in! It will only cost you your life.
[Gurgi is hugging Fflewddur Fflam, who thinks he is being attacked]
Help! Get this thing off me!
Oh, Gurgi's happy day!
[Gurgi puts on Fflewddur's hat]
Wow!
Yes, keep it! It's a gift!

[Holding Fflewddur's harp]
This! Gurgi want this!
Take it! I'm sure you've murdered for less.
We have business with your little hero.
Hero? Gurgi was the hero.
The only thing that mattered to you was the Cauldron, but now it is of no use to you. So we shall take it and be on our way.
Stay your hand, ladies. We never give anything away. We bargain, we trade. Remember?
Did these old ears hear the word "bargain"?
Yes, Madam, your old ears heard right.
Oh, I just adore forceful men.
Oh, pull yourself together, Madam.
[as the army of the dead collapses]
This had better not be your fault!
[grabs Creeper by the neck]
Perhaps it just needs another body, Sire.
Yes. *Yours*!
For your sake, you'd better be telling the truth.
Gurgi not lie. Not this time.

[offering Orddu an apple core]
Gurgi will trade his munchings and crunchings.
Who would want...?
Hold it, sister! Not so fast!
[takes core and eats it]
[as he activates the Black Cauldron]
Now I call on my Army of the Dead; the Cauldron-born! Arise, my messengers of death! Our time has arrived!
I did it, sire! I captured the boy.
But you let the pig get away, didn't you?
I-It wasn't my fault.
[Horned King strangles Creeper]
Throw the boy in the dungeon!
You bring news of the pig?
N-n-not exactly, sire. It's the pig keeper. He-he-he's... escaped.
[the Horned King summons Creeper forward]
Oh, no! Allow me, sire.
[Strangles himself]
Isn't that enough, sire?
Tell me. Is the burning and killing still going on up there?
You're refering to that-that-that-that joke on humanity, the Horned King.
Will no one stand up to him?
We've seen him. And if he ever finds the Black Cauldron, he'll kill us all.
Oh, no. He'll never find it. It's safely hidden, in Morva.
Morva?
At least I think it is. Isn't it, Doli?

[Angry]
What? Is that one of my new jobs? Knowing where the Cauldron was last seen?
Don't worry. He'll find it. You'll see.

[as he is being sucked into the Black Cauldron]
No! You'll not have me! My power cannot die! Curse you!
[repeated line]
Great Belin!
[upon finding Gurgi harrasing a fallen Flewddur]

[angry]
Gurgi!
Master? Uh... old man, uh... fell down!
[nudges Flewddur]
Get up! Get up!
Silly girl. Even if she is a princess.
